Internal function to make survey analysis results

Source: R/svy_make.R
svy_make.Rd

This is a general helper function used by all svy_* functions to reduce code duplication. It handles the common patterns of survey analysis including NA handling, grouping, survey calculations, and result formatting.

Usage

svy_make(
  design,
  vars,
  group = NULL,
  group_key_sep = " -/- ",
  na_rm = TRUE,
  vartype = "ci",
  level = 0.95,
  stat_type = "mean",
  survey_fn,
  unweighted_fn,
  group_by_var = FALSE,
  var_column_name = "var",
  add_var_value = TRUE,
  custom_grouping = NULL,
  custom_var_handling = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

design

A srvyr::design object

vars

Character vector of variables to analyze

group

Character vector of grouping variables (NULL for no grouping)

group_key_sep

Separator for group key values

na_rm

Whether to remove NAs

vartype

Type of variance estimate

level

Confidence level

stat_type

Character string for the type of statistic

survey_fn

Function to call for survey calculation (e.g., srvyr::survey_mean)

unweighted_fn

Function to calculate unweighted statistic (e.g. mean)

group_by_var

Whether to group by the variable itself (for proportions)

var_column_name

What to call the variable column (default "var")

add_var_value

Whether to add a var_value column

custom_grouping

Custom grouping logic (function)

custom_var_handling

Custom variable handling (function)

...

Additional arguments passed to survey_fn

Value

A data.table with survey results
